additionalTextInformation.text:
The painter of this retable was trained in Cranach‘s workshop and sourced inspiration from his collection of templates and preparatory material. He also drew on Dürer prints as a basis for his compositions. Results of a technical examination of the painting do not indicate that it was executed in the Wittenberg workshop. As Friedrich III is represented on this painting future research should concentrate on finding out more about this particular commission and attempt to establish the relationship of the artist responsible for the Mittenwald Retable (http://lucascranach.org/DE_MKM_NONE-MKM001C) with the elector of Saxony.

[see Heydenreich 2016, 149-150]

pageContext.description: The Virgin and Joseph kneel in front of the infant Christ who is surrounded by angels in an open stable building with a wooden gable. The Holy family, like the shepherds kneeling in front of the building, is not in scale with the architecture. Through a door opening the annunciation to the Shepherds, an earlier event, is visible in the far distance. In the sky that is gradually becoming light the star, which would lead the three Kings to Bethlehem, is visible as well as a group of four angels.

pageContext.relatedWorks:
The composition of the central panel of the triptych is heavily reliant upon the designs of Albrecht Dürer, notably his engraving of the Birth of Christ of 1504 and to a lesser degree the woodcut of The Nativity of 1502-5.
[see Heydenreich 2016, 147-149]

tests.text:
Lime wood
[Examination report, Peter Klein, 04. Sept. 2007]

Identification of wood species: lime wood
[Klein Report, 01.12.2013]

DESCRIPTION

Tools/Material: 
- fluid black medium, brush 

Type/Ductus: 
- freehand underdrawing
- thin to somewhat broader lines; possibly some washes 

Function: 
- relatively binding for the final painted version; lively lines delineate the main contours, describe essential details and facial features, no representation of volume with hatching-strokes 


Deviations: 
- very few corrections were made to forms during the painting process; small changes for example the angels in the sky, the faces of the shepherds, the angels surrounding Christ

INTERPRETATION

Attribution: 
- painter of the Mittenwald Retable 
[Sandner, Smith-Contini, Heydenreich, cda 2017]

titles.title: The Adoration of the Shepherds [central panel]
